alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches; Inland Sussex; Kent (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued September 25 at 4:32AM EDT until September 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...One to three feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...In Delaware, Kent, Inland Sussex and Delaware Beaches. In New Jersey, Atlantic, Cape May and Atlantic Coastal Cape May. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At this level, widespread roadway flooding occurs in coastal and bayside communities and along inland tidal waterways. Many roads become impassable. Some damage to vulnerable structures may begin to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Spotty minor flooding is possible with Monday evening`s high tide, but it is expected to be below advisory thresholds. Some additional coastal flooding will be possible with Wednesday evening`s high tide, but water levels look like they will be somewhat lower than Tuesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
